seo.title: What is a VSCU? Virtual Sales Control Unit Explained | Veira
seo.meta_description: Learn everything about Virtual Sales Control Units (VSCU) in Kenya. How it works with e-TIMS, KRA compliance, and why your POS needs it.

content.h1: VSCU Explained: The Heart of Modern Tax Compliance in Kenya
content.introduction: The Virtual Sales Control Unit (VSCU) is the software-based successor to the physical ETR box. As KRA transitions to e-TIMS, understanding how the VSCU functions is critical for every business owner in Kenya.

sections.heading: The Technical Definition of a VSCU
sections.body:
A VSCU is a secure software module that resides within your Point of Sale (POS) system. Unlike the old TIMS system which required a physical hardware device to sign invoices, the VSCU communicates directly with KRA's servers via an API. 

When you process a sale, the VSCU generates a unique digital signature and a QR code that is printed on the receipt. This ensures that the transaction is recorded by KRA in real-time, providing transparency and reducing the need for manual tax filing.

sections.heading: Why the Shift from Physical to Virtual?
sections.body: Physical ETR machines were prone to hardware failure, battery issues, and memory limits. A VSCU eliminates these bottlenecks. Because it is software-based, it can be updated remotely to comply with new tax laws without requiring you to buy new hardware. It also allows for 'offline' buffering—storing signatures locally when the internet is down and syncing them once the connection returns.

faq.question: Do I need a physical ETR if I have a VSCU?
faq.answer: No. A VSCU-integrated POS system like Veira fulfills all legal requirements for tax invoicing in Kenya, making physical ETR boxes redundant.

faq.question: Is VSCU data secure?
faq.answer: Yes, VSCU communications use high-level encryption protocols mandated by KRA to ensure that your business data is transmitted securely.

seo.meta_description: Learn how to integrate M-Pesa with your Point of Sale system. Automate reconciliation, reduce theft, and speed up checkout in your shop.

content.h1: The Ultimate Guide to M-Pesa POS Integration in Kenya
content.introduction: M-Pesa is the lifeblood of Kenyan commerce. Manually checking messages on a phone is slow and leads to errors. Integrating M-Pesa directly into your POS is the single biggest efficiency gain you can make for your business.

sections.heading: How M-Pesa Integration Works
sections.body:
There are two main ways to integrate M-Pesa: 

1. **STK Push (Daraja API):** When you checkout on the POS, the customer receives a prompt on their phone to enter their PIN. Once they pay, the POS receives a confirmation instantly and prints the receipt. 
2. **C2B (Validation & Confirmation):** The customer pays to your Till or Paybill manually. The POS listens for the payment and automatically matches it to the open order. 

Veira supports both methods, ensuring that every cent is accounted for without manual entry.

sections.heading: Benefits of Automated Reconciliation
sections.body: Manual reconciliation is where most retail theft happens. Staff might delete a sale after receiving the M-Pesa message. With integration, the sale cannot be completed until the payment is verified by the system. This creates a foolproof audit trail and saves you hours of work at the end of the day.

faq.question: Do I need a special Till for integration?
faq.answer: You need a Lipa na M-Pesa Till or Paybill. Veira works with both standard Tills and the newer 'Pochi la Biashara' for small businesses.

faq.question: Are there extra transaction fees?
faq.answer: Safaricom charges their standard Lipa na M-Pesa fees. Veira does not add any extra transaction fees for the integration.

content.call_to_action: Connect your M-Pesa to Veira today.
